Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model, with an extrude depth of 0.1818 towards the normal and an extrude depth of 0.1818 opposite the normal respectively. **Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with Parallel Sides** Create a new coordinate system using the following parameters: Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Translation Vector: [0.0058, 0.0058, 0.75] Draw the following 2D sketch on the XY plane of the newly created coordinate system: Sketch: Face 1: Loop 1: Line 1: Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] End Point: [0.7157, 0.0] Line 2: Start Point: [0.7157, 0.0] End Point: [0.7157, 0.7157] Line 3: Start Point: [0.7157, 0.7157] End Point: [0.0, 0.7157] Line 4: Start Point: [0.0, 0.7157] End Point: [0.0, 0.0] Set the sketch scaling parameter to 0.7157. Extrude the 2D sketch, with an extrude depth of 0 towards the normal and an extrude depth of 0.7157 opposite the normal. The final 3D model is a rectangular prism with a curved top and bottom, connected by a curved line, creating a continuous loop. The top and bottom curves are smooth and the sides of the prism are straight. The model is symmetrical along the central axis.</description>
